definition.en: The legislation that mandates the creation or management of the Catalogue.

usage.en:
For HVD the value must include the ELI http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2023/138/oj.
As multiple legislations may apply to the resource the maximum cardinality is not limited.

definition.en: The legislation that mandates the creation or management of the Data Service.

usage.en:
For HVD the value must include the ELI http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2023/138/oj.
As multiple legislations may apply to the resource the maximum cardinality is not limited.

definition.en: The legislation that mandates the creation or management of the Data Service.

usage.en:
For HVD the value must include the ELI http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2023/138/oj.
As multiple legislations may apply to the resource the maximum cardinality is not limited.

definition.en: The legislation that mandates the creation or management of the Data Service.

usage.en:
For HVD the value must include the ELI http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2023/138/oj.
As multiple legislations may apply to the resource the maximum cardinality is not limited.

definition.en: The HVD category to which this Dataset belongs.
The HVD category to which this Distribution belongs.
The HVD category to which this Data Service belongs.
This class represents the legislation, policy or policies that lie behind the Rules that govern the service.

usage.en:
The definition and properties of the Legal Resource class are aligned with the ontology included in "Council conclusions inviting the introduction of the European Legislation Identifier (ELI)". For describing the attributes of a Legal Resource (labels, preferred labels, alternative labels, definition, etc.) we refer to the ELI ontology.

In this data specification the use is restricted to instances of this class that follow the ELI URI guidelines.

definition.en: A legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource.

usage.en: The HVD regulation requires a machine readable representation of a Licence. The minimal data model to describe a licence Document is beyond this specification. Nevertheless in [[[#c3]]] some suggestions are made.

definition.en: A statement about the intellectual property rights (IPR) held in or over a resource, a legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource, or a statement about access rights.
A standard or other specification to which a Dataset or Distribution conforms.

A literal value such as a string or integer; Literals may be typed, e.g. as a date according to xsd:date. Literals that contain human-readable text have an optional language tag as defined by BCP 4715.
Anything described by RDF.
A description following the vCard specification, e.g. to provide telephone number and e-mail address for a contact point.

usage.en: Note that the class Kind is the parent class for the four explicit types of vCards (Individual, Organization, Location, Group).

definition.en: An identifier in a particular context, consisting of the string that is the identifier; an optional identifier for the identifier scheme; an optional identifier for the version of the identifier scheme; an optional identifier for the agency that manages t
A catalogue or repository that hosts the Datasets or Data Services being described.
A description of a DatasetÂ’s entry in the Catalogue.
A collection of operations that provides access to one or more datasets or data processing functions.
A conceptual entity that represents the information published.
A physical embodiment of the Dataset in a particular format.

usage.en: Bulk downloads should be encoded as a Distribution.

definition.en: Resource published or curated by a single agent.

usage.en: For DCAT-AP, the class is considered an abstract notion.

definition.en: Any entity carrying out actions with respect to the (Core) entities Catalogue, Datasets, Data Services and Distributions.

usage.en: If the Agent is an organisation, the use of the Organization Ontology is recommended.

definition.en: A textual resource intended for human consumption that contains information, e.g. a web page about a Dataset.
An implementing rule or other specification.

usage.en: The provided information should enable to the verification whether the detailed information requirements by the HVD is satisfied.

definition.en: An established schema to which the described Distribution conforms.
A licence under which the Catalogue can be used or reused.
A licence under which the Distribution is made available.
A licence under which the Data service is made available.
An entity (organisation) responsible for making the Dataset available.
An entity (organisation) responsible for making the Catalogue available.
A statement that specifies rights associated with the Distribution.
A name given to the Data Service.

usage.en: This property can be repeated for parallel language versions of the name.

definition.en: A email address via which contact can be made.
A webpage that either allows to make contact (i.e. a webform) or the information contains how to get into contact.Â
A secondary identifier of the Dataset, such as MAST/ADS17, DataCite18, DOI19, EZID20 or W3ID21.

usage.en:
It is recommended to include all identifiers that the catalogue knows about this dataset.
This allows others to find datasets more easily back.

definition.en: A data service that gives access to the distribution of the dataset
A URL that gives access to a Distribution of the Dataset.

usage.en: The resource at the access URL may contain information about how to get the Dataset.

definition.en: Contact information that can be used for sending comments about the Dataset.
Contact information that can be used for sending comments about the Dataset.
A Dataset that is part of the Catalogue.

usage.en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the next property service to implement an empty Catalogue check.

definition.en: An available Distribution for the Dataset.
A description of the services available via the end-points, including their operations, parameters etc.

usage.en: The property gives specific details of the actual endpoint instances, while dct:conformsTo is used to indicate the general standard or specification that the endpoints implement.

definition.en: The root location or primary endpoint of the service (an IRI).

usage.en: The endpoint URL should be persistent. This means that publishers should do everything in their power to maintain the value stable and existing.

definition.en: A Catalogue Record that is part of the Catalogue
This property refers to a collection of data that this data service can distribute.
A site or end-point (Data Service) that is listed in the Catalogue.

usage.en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the previous property dataset to implement an empty Catalogue check.

definition.en: A web page that provides details the quality of service the Data Service provides and/or additional information.

usage.en: Quality of service covers a broad spectrum of aspects. The HVD regulation does not list any mandatory topic.

definition.en: A link to the Dataset, Data service or Catalog described in the record.

usage.en: A catalogue record will refer to one entity in a catalogue. This can be either a Dataset or a Data Service. To ensure an unambigous reading of the cardinality the range is set to Catalogued Resource. However it is not the intend with this range to require the explicit use of the class Catalogued Record. As abstract class, an subclass should be used.
